thread.title: NUS STUDENT COMPLAINS OF GETTING "HARASSED" BY CHRISTIANS IN SCHOOL
thread.title_full: NUS STUDENT COMPLAINS OF GETTING "HARASSED" BY CHRISTIANS IN SCHOOL

author: farhan
title: NUS STUDENT COMPLAINS OF GETTING "HARASSED" BY CHRISTIANS IN SCHOOL
text:
NUS STUDENT COMPLAINS OF GETTING "HARASSED" BY CHRISTIANS IN SCHOOL   Advertisement 
<Credits: NUS Whispers> 
I have nothing against Christians, but I have been hounded by members of the NUS christian society at least 4 times in the past fortnight, and I feel very harassed by them. 
When I say I am a free-thinker, they say something to the effect of "still, we'd like to share about God and the bible" and continue on for at least a good 15 minutes. One pair even replied in a condescending tone of "I hope God will make you become a believer" after being told I'm not interested. 
Nothing you say will make me change my beliefs. Why not move on upon receiving the first "no"? Do you know how offensive it is for you to impose your religion randomly on others even after getting rejected several times?
